input: Perform a critical structured analysis of clinical trial protocols to identify risks and compliance issues, propose revisions, and deliver both technical and executive summaries.

inputs.name: C
inputs.input_data: Complete clinical trial protocol in PDF/DOCX format

inputs.name: R
inputs.source_origin: Official regulatory databases/APIs (e.g., FDA’s open API, EMA website)
inputs.input_data: Structured text of current compliance requirements

inputs.name: H
inputs.source_origin: Internal audit system or public FDA inspection databases
inputs.input_data: Structured records of past violations and remediations

inputs.name: S
inputs.input_data: Weighted risk factors (e.g., patient safety, data integrity)

inputs.name: R
inputs.source_origin: Combination of Regulatory Guidelines (Input 2) and SME Risk Criteria (Input 4)

inputs.name: C
inputs.input_data: Structured checklist mapping protocol sections to compliance rules

steps:
Uses: Clinical Trial Protocol Document (Input 1)  
Action: Extract key protocol elements (study design, endpoints, inclusion criteria)  
Produces: Structured Protocol Metadata  
Stores/Sends To: Internal working database

Uses: Regulatory Guidelines (Input 2)  
Action: Retrieve and parse compliance rules into structured checklist format  
Produces: Compliance Rule Set  
Stores/Sends To: Compliance Check Framework (Input 6)

Uses: SME Risk Criteria (Input 4), Regulatory Guidelines (Input 2)  
Action: Combine weighted risk factors with regulatory priorities to define assessment criteria  
Produces: Risk Assessment Criteria (Input 5)  
Stores/Sends To: Risk analysis module

Uses: Compliance Check Framework (Input 6), Structured Protocol Metadata  
Action: Map protocol elements to compliance rules to identify gaps  
Produces: Preliminary Compliance Violation List  
Stores/Sends To: Internal working database

Uses: Historical Compliance Violation Database (Input 3), Preliminary Compliance Violation List  
Action: Cross-reference gaps with historical violations to prioritize risks  
Produces: Prioritized Compliance Risk Matrix  
Stores/Sends To: Risk analysis module

Uses: Risk Assessment Criteria (Input 5), Structured Protocol Metadata  
Action: Apply risk scoring model to protocol elements  
Produces: Protocol Risk Scores  
Stores/Sends To: Risk analysis module

Uses: Prioritized Compliance Risk Matrix, Protocol Risk Scores  
Action: Synthesize findings into technical and executive summaries  
Produces: Protocol Risk Analysis Report, Technical Summary, Executive Summary  
Stores/Sends To: Output directory

Uses: Protocol Risk Analysis Report  
Action: Generate annotated revision proposals with version control  
Produces: Revision Proposal Package  
Stores/Sends To: Versioned document repository
execution_plan.raw_response:
Inputs:  
1. Clinical Trial Protocol Document  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: User uploads the document  
   Input Data: Complete clinical trial protocol in PDF/DOCX format  
   Bound Reference: N/A  
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

2. Regulatory Guidelines (ICH-GCP, FDA 21 CFR Part 312)  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: Official regulatory databases/APIs (e.g., FDA’s open API, EMA website)  
   Input Data: Structured text of current compliance requirements  
   Bound Reference: N/A  

3. Historical Compliance Violation Database  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: Internal audit system or public FDA inspection databases  
   Input Data: Structured records of past violations and remediations  
   Bound Reference: N/A  

4. Subject Matter Expert (SME) Risk Criteria  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: User-provided spreadsheet or form  
   Input Data: Weighted risk factors (e.g., patient safety, data integrity)  
   Bound Reference: N/A  
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

5. Risk Assessment Criteria  
   Source Type: DERIVABLE  
   Source Origin: Combination of Regulatory Guidelines (Input 2) and SME Risk Criteria (Input 4)  
   Input Data: Prioritized risk categories and thresholds  
   Bound Reference: Inputs 2, 4  
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]  

6. Compliance Check Framework  
   Source Type: DERIVABLE  
   Source Origin: Regulatory Guidelines (Input 2)  
   Input Data: Structured checklist mapping protocol sections to compliance rules  
   Bound Reference: Input 2  
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]  

Outputs:  
1. Protocol Risk Analysis Report  
   Type: Observable artifact  
   Description: Detailed risk scores and compliance gaps  
   Storage: PDF/DOCX file  

2. Technical Summary  
   Type: Observable artifact  
   Description: Risk mitigation strategies and protocol adjustments  
   Storage: PDF/DOCX file  

3. Executive Summary  
   Type: Observable artifact  
   Description: High-level compliance risks and business impacts  
   Storage: PDF/DOCX file  

4. Revision Proposal Package  
   Type: Observable artifact  
   Description: Annotated protocol with suggested changes  
   Storage: Versioned document with change logs  

Steps:  
Step 1:  
Uses: Clinical Trial Protocol Document (Input 1)  
Action: Extract key protocol elements (study design, endpoints, inclusion criteria)  
Produces: Structured Protocol Metadata  
Stores/Sends To: Internal working database  

Step 2:  
Uses: Regulatory Guidelines (Input 2)  
Action: Retrieve and parse compliance rules into structured checklist format  
Produces: Compliance Rule Set  
Stores/Sends To: Compliance Check Framework (Input 6)  

Step 3:  
Uses: SME Risk Criteria (Input 4), Regulatory Guidelines (Input 2)  
Action: Combine weighted risk factors with regulatory priorities to define assessment criteria  
Produces: Risk Assessment Criteria (Input 5)  
Stores/Sends To: Risk analysis module  

Step 4:  
Uses: Compliance Check Framework (Input 6), Structured Protocol Metadata  
Action: Map protocol elements to compliance rules to identify gaps  
Produces: Preliminary Compliance Violation List  
Stores/Sends To: Internal working database  

Step 5:  
Uses: Historical Compliance Violation Database (Input 3), Preliminary Compliance Violation List  
Action: Cross-reference gaps with historical violations to prioritize risks  
Produces: Prioritized Compliance Risk Matrix  
Stores/Sends To: Risk analysis module  

Step 6:  
Uses: Risk Assessment Criteria (Input 5), Structured Protocol Metadata  
Action: Apply risk scoring model to protocol elements  
Produces: Protocol Risk Scores  
Stores/Sends To: Risk analysis module  

Step 7:  
Uses: Prioritized Compliance Risk Matrix, Protocol Risk Scores  
Action: Synthesize findings into technical and executive summaries  
Produces: Protocol Risk Analysis Report, Technical Summary, Executive Summary  
Stores/Sends To: Output directory  

Step 8:  
Uses: Protocol Risk Analysis Report  
Action: Generate annotated revision proposals with version control  
Produces: Revision Proposal Package  
Stores/Sends To: Versioned document repository  

Dependency Consistency Check:  
- All inputs used in steps  
- No implicit data sources  
- USER/SYSTEM inputs explicitly identified  
- DERIVABLE inputs fully decomposed  
- All leaf inputs are USER/SYSTEM type  
- Source/Input pairs bound and separated

aeb_analysis.aeb_analysis_raw:
### Step-by-Step Analysis:

---

**Step 1**  
- **Step:** Uses: Clinical Trial Protocol Document (Input 1). Action: Extract key protocol elements (study design, endpoints, inclusion criteria). Produces: Structured Protocol Metadata. Stores/Sends To: Internal working database  
- **Is AEB:** Yes  
- **Reason:** Single intent (extracting protocol elements), interacts with one system boundary (internal database), no branching/sequencing, and can be implemented as a single parsing function.  
- **If No:** N/A  

---

**Step 2**  
- **Step:** Uses: Regulatory Guidelines (Input 2). Action: Retrieve and parse compliance rules into structured checklist format. Produces: Compliance Rule Set. Stores/Sends To: Compliance Check Framework (Input 6)  
- **Is AEB:** Yes  
- **Reason:** Single intent (parsing compliance rules), interacts with one system boundary (Compliance Check Framework), no branching/sequencing, and can be implemented as a single API call.  
- **If No:** N/A  

---

**Step 3**  
- **Step:** Uses: SME Risk Criteria (Input 4), Regulatory Guidelines (Input 2). Action: Combine weighted risk factors with regulatory priorities to define assessment criteria. Produces: Risk Assessment Criteria (Input 5). Stores/Sends To: Risk analysis module  
- **Is AEB:** No  
- **Reason:** Combines two distinct inputs (weighted risk factors and regulatory priorities) with implicit logic for weighting and prioritization. This may involve branching (e.g., conditional prioritization rules) or sequencing (e.g., first weighting, then combining).  
- **Suggest:** Break into two AEBs:  
  1. Apply weights to SME Risk Criteria.  
  2. Merge weighted SME criteria with regulatory priorities.  

---

**Step 4**  
- **Step:** Uses: Compliance Check Framework (Input 6), Structured Protocol Metadata. Action: Map protocol elements to compliance rules to identify gaps. Produces: Preliminary Compliance Violation List. Stores/Sends To: Internal working database  
- **Is AEB:** Yes  
- **Reason:** Single intent (mapping protocol elements to rules), interacts with one system boundary (internal database), no branching/sequencing, and can be implemented as a single comparison function.  
- **If No:** N/A  

---

**Step 5
